Technique_Material.Technique_and_Material: Reed and quill pen and ink and pencil on paper

Provenance.provenance_description: Kjøpt på Den frie Udstilling i København i 1893, jfr. Messel 2016.
Arven administrert av hans mor Joanna van Gogh-Bonger. Solgt av henne til Hans Chr. Christensen på Den frie Udstilling i 1893.

Production.production_Dating: Jfr. Ives m.fl. 2005. Wolk, Pickvance og Pey 1990: Mai. Faille 1992: Tidlig i juni. Heugten 2005: Mai.

Object.legalBodyName: The National Museum of Art, Architecture and Design

Provenance.provenance_name: Marie Julien og Joseph Michel Ginoux
Provenance.provenance_datingcomment_: Note nr. 96 i Louis van Tilborgh m.fl.: Van Gogh as mentally ill: the compelling history of his contested Self-portrait in Oslo, Burlington Magazine, februar 2020: Van Gogh visited Arles in mid-November 1889 (Letters, no.820), but it is unclear whether he visited the Ginouxs at that time. He certainly did so during his visit of 18 or 19 January 1890, when he wanted to return the boxes in which the couple had sent him olives but then forgot to do so; see ibid., nos.841, note 1, 842, 850, note 22. Another argument in favour of this later date of transfer is that two other friends from Arles also received paintings from him around this time.

Note nr. 55 i Louis van Tilborgh m.fl.: Van Gogh as mentally ill: the compelling history of his contested Self-portrait in Oslo, Burlington Magazine, februar 2020: The correspondence between Ambroise Vollard and Henry Laget, the Ginouxs’ intermediary in Arles, shows that the couple sent a total of nineteen Van Gogh paintings to Paris in July 1895 (Vollard Archive, Musée d’Orsay, Paris, MS 421 (2.2)). Within two years, Vollard had sold ten of them, including a ‘portrait de Van Gogh’ on 21 March to the dealer Maurice Clouet, who probably sold it back to Vollard before 1904.
Se også: Marit Lange, The provenance of Vincent van Gogh’s “Selfportrait” in Oslo’, The Burlington Magazine 148 (2006), pp.113–16
Marit Lange, The provenance of Vincent van Gogh’s “Selfportrait” in Oslo’, The Burlington Magazine 148 (2006), pp.113–16
